content:
Has anybody tried using Isabelle in Visual Studio Code together with Visual Studio Code Remote Development?
No more tormenting my poor laptop with sledgehammer commands :grinning:
No, but I wonder what the current status of remote Isabelle is. It's been in the works for a while and Makarius laid the foundations for it years ago.
Also, maybe your laptop would struggle less if you didn't all insist on buying Apple hardware with crappy performance. :P
The unicode business in VSCode is still holding me back from using it
Clickable state panel in VS/Code is also not there

Max W. Haslbeck said:

Has anybody tried using Isabelle in Visual Studio Code together with Visual Studio Code Remote Development?
No more tormenting my poor laptop with sledgehammer commands :grinning:

I use emacs for that (X-forwarding or SSH). But I have not started Isabelle/VSCode in a while to compare: does it finally have a theory panel?
